name: vscode-povray2
description: Persistence of Vision Ray Tracer (POV-Ray) Extension v2 for Visual Studio Code, forked from jmaxwilson/vscode-povray

filePath.description: The full path to the source file

outFilePath.description: The full path to the output file

povray.render.pvenginePath.description: Path to the POV-Ray povray/pvengine executable.

povray.render.win32Terminal.description: Windows Only: Which terminal should be used?

povray.render.defaultWidth.description: The default width in pixels for rendered scene images

povray.render.defaultHeight.description: The default height in pixels for rendered scene images

povray.render.outputImageFormat.description: The image format to use for rendered scenes

povray.render.displayImageDuringRender.markdownDescription: Display the image while it is being rendered [Note: this POV-Ray feature may not be available on all platforms]

povray.render.openImageAfterRender.description: Automatically open the rendered image when rendering finishes?

povray.render.openImageAfterRenderInNewC.description: When the rendered image is automatically opened, open it in a new column beside the current editor

povray.render.outputPath.description: A path to a folder where rendered images will be saved. This can be an absolute path (/pov/output) or a relative path (./output). (Note: if the directory doesn't exist already it will be created at render time.) Defaults to ./ (same folder as .pov file), refer to POV-Ray for allowed output directories (https://github.com/POV-Ray/povray/issues/324).

povray.render.customCommandlineOptions.markdownDescription: Additional [commandline options](https://www.povray.org/documentation/3.7.0/r3_2.html) to add to POV-Ray when rendering the scene.

povray.render.libraryPath.description: The Library Path where POV-Ray can find all of the standard include files. (Note: You should only really need to use this on Mac.)
